de.iss.mv2.security

Interface SymetricKeyGenerator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable<SymetricKeyGenerator>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AESKeyGenerator

    public interface SymetricKeyGenerator
extends Cloneable<SymetricKeyGenerator>
    Used to generate symmetric keys for the encrypted communication. AESKeyGenerator is the default implementation of this interface.
    Author:
    Marcel Singer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getRandomIV()
      Returns a random IV using the default size.
      byte[] getRandomKey()
      Returns a random key using the default size.
      byte[] getRandomKey(int length)
      Creates and returns a random key with the given strength.
      boolean hasFixedKeyAndIV()
      Returns true if the key and IV is fixed.
      void setFixedIV(byte[] iv)
      Sets the fixed IV to return for all subsequent calls of getRandomIV().
      void setFixedKey(byte[] key)
      Sets the fixed key to return for all subsequent calls of getRandomKey().

      • Methods inherited from interface de.iss.mv2.security.Cloneable

        doClone

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomKey

        byte[] getRandomKey()
        Returns a random key using the default size.
        Note: Once a fixed key or iv is set the result of this method should be the fixed one.
        Returns:
        The generated or set random key.

      • getRandomKey

        byte[] getRandomKey(int length)
        Creates and returns a random key with the given strength.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the key to create in bytes.
        Returns:
        The generated random key.

      • getRandomIV

        byte[] getRandomIV()
        Returns a random IV using the default size.
        Note: Once a fixed key or iv is set the result of this method should be the fixed IV.
        Returns:
        The generated or set IV.

      • setFixedKey

        void setFixedKey(byte[] key)
        Sets the fixed key to return for all subsequent calls of getRandomKey().
        Parameters:
        key - The key to set.

      • setFixedIV

        void setFixedIV(byte[] iv)
        Sets the fixed IV to return for all subsequent calls of getRandomIV().
        Parameters:
        iv -

      • hasFixedKeyAndIV

        boolean hasFixedKeyAndIV()
        Returns true if the key and IV is fixed.
        Returns:
        true if the key and IV is fixed.
